news.title: Noida Metro's Aqua Line extension till Boraki multi-modal hub gets Centre’s nod
news.para: The Centre has approved extending Noida Metro's Aqua Line to Boraki, bringing it closer to Noida International Airport. This 2.6-km elevated stretch, costing ₹416 crore, will include Junpat and Boraki stations, expected to be ready in three years. The extension aims to connect to a multi-modal transport hub, integrating rail, bus, and rapid rail services.

news.title: ED probes high-rise clearance scam, seizes cash linked to suspended HMDA official
news.para: Enforcement Directorate investigates Siva Balakrishna, suspended HMDA director. Searches reveal suspicious real estate deals and unaccounted cash. The probe links to alleged illegal gratification for project clearances. Raids on realtors uncover incriminating documents.

news.title: Telangana RERA slaps penalties on five developers over delays, violations
news.para: Telangana RERA has penalized several real estate developers for violations concerning villa, flat, and plot sales, following complaints from aggrieved consumers. Penalties were imposed on five developers, including Suvarnabhoomi Infra and Edifice Projects, for project delays, failure to register projects, and misleading advertisements. RERA directed the developers to rectify the issues, pay fines, and refund amounts to buyers with interest.

news.title: Telangana: Consumer court pulls up builders, orders compensation in two cases
news.para: Ranga Reddy consumer commission ruled in favor of consumers in two real estate disputes. Rajitha Guduru will receive a refund with interest for a failed land investment in Warangal. N Gayathri and N Rajasekhar Reddy were awarded possession of a flat in Narsingi, along with compensation. The court held builders accountable for delays and false promises.

news.title: UK's Rightmove beats sales estimates, warns of slower growth in second half
news.para: Rightmove exceeded first-half sales forecasts due to increased platform inquiries, although it anticipates growth will decelerate from last year's peak. While easing mortgage rates and competitive pricing have stimulated buyer interest, inflationary pressures and economic uncertainty are impacting consumer confidence. The company maintains its full-year revenue growth outlook of 8% to 10%.

news.title: Asian Paints aims to quash antitrust inquiry, saying investigation order mishandled
news.para: Asian Paints is contesting an antitrust inquiry, alleging the CCI damaged its reputation by initially publishing, then deleting, allegations against its CEO concerning threats to raw material suppliers dealing with rival Birla Opus. The paints giant claims the unexplained order change undermines the proceedings' integrity and harms its CEO's reputation. The court will hear Asian Paints' challenge on August 6.

news.title: Orient Cement's profit rises multi-fold to ₹205 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Orient Cement Ltd, now under the Adani Group, witnessed a significant surge in net profit, reaching Rs 205.37 crore in the June 2025 quarter, a substantial increase from the previous year. Revenue also climbed by 24.44 per cent to Rs 866.47 crore. Following an acquisition, Adani Group's shareholding increased to 72.

news.title: IndiQube Spaces IPO subscribed 12.33 times on closing day of bidding
news.para: IndiQube Spaces' IPO witnessed strong investor demand, subscribing 12.33 times with significant interest from QIBs and retail investors. The Bengaluru-based firm plans to utilize the raised capital for expansion and debt repayment. With a diverse client base and a growing portfolio, IndiQube aims to list its shares on BSE and NSE by July 30.

news.title: Brigade Hotel Ventures' IPO subscribed 1.19 times on day 2 of offer
news.para: Brigade Hotel Ventures Ltd's IPO saw a subscription of 1.19 times on its second day, with strong retail interest at 4.65 times. The IPO aims to raise ₹759.6 crore, using proceeds for debt repayment, land acquisition, and strategic initiatives. The company, a subsidiary of Brigade Enterprises, operates nine hotels across India with 1,604 keys.

news.title: Sobha posts net profit of ₹13.61 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Sobha has announced a significant surge in its financial performance. The company's net consolidated profit witnessed a substantial increase. It grew by 124.96 percent during the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Profit after tax reached ₹13.61 crore in Q1 FY26.

news.title: Aadhar Housing Finance's net profit up 18.56% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Aadhar Housing Finance reported a robust Q1 FY26, showcasing an 18.56% increase in net consolidated profit, reaching ₹237.28 crore. The company's total income grew by 19.38% to ₹851.34 crore, driven by strong demand in the affordable housing segment.

news.title: Home First Finance Company's net profit rises 35.47% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Home First Finance Company India reveals a 35.47% net profit surge for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. Profit after tax reaches ₹118.89 crore. Total income climbs to ₹455.26 crore. Assets under management rise to ₹13,479 crore. The company successfully completes a QIP of ₹1,250 crore. Credit rating upgrades to AA (Stable).

news.title: Gravity Bath looks to touch ₹1,000 crore by FY29
news.para: Gravity Bath has announced impressive revenue figures, exceeding ₹200 crore. The company is targeting substantial growth, aiming for ₹1,000 crore by FY 2028–29. Expansion plans include penetrating Tier 1 and 2 cities.

news.title: Arkade Developers' net profit declines 4.83% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Arkade Developers announced its Q1 FY26 results. The company's net profit declined by 4.83 percent. It stood at ₹28.75 crore. However, total income increased by 31.64 percent to ₹165.22 crore. Pre-sales grew by 17.1 percent. Collections rose by 41.8 percent.

news.title: Elan Group repays ₹875 crore to Asia Pragati ahead of schedule
news.para: Elan Group has repaid its ₹875 crore debt to Asia Pragati Strategic Investment Fund. The investment was made in 2022. The funds were used for growth capital. This move will reduce interest liabilities. It will also strengthen liquidity for the company.

news.title: Mahindra Lifespaces posts net profit of ₹51.26 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Mahindra Lifespace Developers announced a net profit of ₹51.26 crore for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026. The company's income was ₹40.61 crore. A rights issue improved the balance sheet. Gross development value additions reached ₹3,500 crore. Residential pre-sales were ₹449 crore. The IC&IC business saw healthy leasing activity in Jaipur and Chennai.

news.title: Toto India aims to reach turnover of ₹500 crore in FY26
news.para: Toto India Industries, a Toto Group company, reports a 20% growth. The company targets ₹500 crore turnover by FY26. Yusuke Sasaya is the new unit head. Toto plans expansion in premium hospitality projects, high-end residences and commercial spaces. The company operates with 120-140 dealers across India. Its Halol, Gujarat plant produces five lakh sanitary ware pieces annually.

news.title: Orient Electric's net profit increases by 22.18% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Orient Electric announced a 22.18% increase in net consolidated profit for Q1 FY26, reaching ₹17.52 crore. The company's total income grew by 1.88% to ₹771.56 crore, driven by a 7% growth in the lighting and switchgear segment.

news.title: Owners of properties stuck in gunthewari hope for regularisation as Maharashtra scraps act
news.para: Thousands of property owners in Pune may soon find relief as the Maharashtra government has repealed the Tukde Bandi law, potentially regularizing gunthewari properties. This move aims to allow registration, building permits, and property rights for land divisions up to one guntha made before January 1, 2025.

news.title: Danda panchayat secretary suspended over housing scheme irregularities
news.para: In Garhwa, Danda panchayat secretary Shambhu Prasad faced suspension. Deputy commissioner Dinesh Kumar Yadav took action due to alleged irregularities. Prasad reportedly included ineligible individuals in Abua Aawas Yojana during 2023-24.
